name: The Pacific Inn

reviews.title: fantastic hotel and great location
reviews.text: nice and helpful staff! Great location...steps away from shops and restaurants and about a 10 minute walk to seal beach! The hotel and the room was very clean. I wouldnt say there were any problems with this place only the pool was very chilly...its not heated just through the atrium when the sun shines down on it. My two year old was pretty cold and didnt stay long in it.

I have been coming here to the Inn for about 5 years since my sister lives innthe area and we like to walk to all the downtown restaurants and shop; have a drink and not have to worry about driving. This is THE ONLY place walking distance to down town Seal so it gets pretty full on weekends so book ahead. They offer a locals discount so ask if u call for reservations. They recently painted the hallways.!! Before they had a horrid gold color that I used to complain about everytime I was here.. They finally heard me. Now it's a lovely warm 2 tone brown. Rooms are always clean and all have a nice balcony. and free wifi!! Ask for a back side room as there are fast food restaurants across the street and they stay noisier than the back parking lot side There are lots of nice restaurants in the area We like Walts Wharf.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel Close to Downtown Seal Beach Recently Improved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for improving a good thing...
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pacific Inn was recommended by a friend from Long Beach and it was ideal for our one night stay. The room was comfortable, clean and had free internet access. We were able to park the car in the hotel car park and not have to use it until we left. The hotel is ideally located for all that Seal Beach has to offer and is only a few blocks from the beach. A complimentary continental breakfast was included and was ideal, plenty of choice including making your own waffles! All staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay at Pacific Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pacific Inn is the ideal place to stay when visiting Seal Beach. We have family there and have previously rented houses when we've gone to visit. From now on we will stay at the Pacific Inn. All of the staff are pleasant and helpful. The dead bolt on our door didn't work and a hook in the bathroom was loose. We advised the front desk and the maintenance man immediately took care of everything. Cleanliness is my No. 1 concern and the Pacific Inn surpassed my high standards. Every part of the hotel is clean and neat. The housekeeping staff do an outstanding job.
reviews.title: Terrific Stay!

reviews.text: Booked this hotel through www.hotwire.com. Hotwire showed this hotel as a 3-star, which I don't agree. More of a 2.5 star. The rooms were average, disappointed that there were 2 double sized beds, queen beds would be a lot more comfortable. Unfortunately we were given a room that connected to another. We could hear the neighbours talking & flushing their toilet. Didn't like the sliding bathroom door that had no lock. Carpets didn't feel clean enough to take off our shoes.
reviews.title: Just ok, for the price

reviews.text: On the plus side, the rooms had a balcony. Hotel has continental breakfast which included fruit, yogurt, cereal & waffles.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay!

reviews.text: The location is right off Pacific Coast Highway. Across the street there is a McDonalds (woken up @ 5am by the McDonalds delivery truck) & Taco Bell/Pizza Hut. We tried Yucatan around the corner & loved it!
reviews.title: Cool staff, helpful, clean motel and very great prices..

reviews.text: I'd only recommend this hotel for business travellers.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Experience

reviews.text: We always stay at the Pacific Inn now and are completely satisfied. The people are friendly, the location is great, the breakfast is good, the rooms are always comfortable and the pool area is a big plus. We haven't had our pets with us, but they are pet friendly which is a big plus in my book.
reviews.title: Cozy lodging that warrants much more publicity than it receives.
Excellent Value, Perfect Location, Staff Superior
reviews.text: We just finished out stay at the Pacific Inn and I can not say enough positive about this hotel. It is a mid -range hotel, and while the exterior and lobby will initially give you concerns, ignore and enjoy, the rooms are much more upscale. Nice size, great beds, very clean. The little balcony is a nice touch. The staff, and I mean everyone I came in contact with, is by far the most pleasant I have dealt with in years. You truly feel as if they appreciate your business. The location is absolutley perfect. Close to everything. Free internet, free underbuilding parking. Nice little Continental Breakfast. Use your intetrnet, we were able to book for $139. We will never stay anywhere else when going to the Orange County beach's for the week-end or business. As a plus they are pet friendly.

We stayed at the Pacific Inn when going to a wedding in downtown Long Beach (just ~10 minute drive). It was pretty affordable and surprisingly nice for the price. The rooms are pretty spacious and have a little balcony off them. The air conditioner worked well and was not too loud (unlike some other cheaper motel chains).
reviews.title: Really nice...and affordable!

reviews.text: Stayed with my mother in this hotel whilst visiting family, for ten days. The hotel is situated in a lovely location within walking distance of eateries/shops/beach. The staff were very helpful. The room clean and refreshed on a daily basis. The complimentary breakfast adequate. (I use the word adequate only because I like a good fry up on holiday). The Pool looked inviting but on this trip i did not manage a dip. The complimentary shuttle was used by my mother to attend church and she was impressed by the service. The free wifi was easily accessible/speedy and a bonus. All in all a thoroughly enjoyable stay and would definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable/Clean/Friendly/Ideal Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located, next to shops, restaurants and the beach.
reviews.title: Great location, bad acoustic

reviews.text: The front of the hotel and the hall would need a serious renovation. The rooms are much better than expected. They are spacious and bathroom was great with a nice big shower, nice little terrace.
reviews.title: Wish I liked it better

reviews.text: Very friendly staff and met my every need as well as my every want. Staff takes time to show they care about each and every customer. Great little inn with a pool centered on the second floor in the center of rooms with a half open roof top. Nice to find a place to tan but also enough shade. The pool has just been renovated to make an even better stay. For breakfast, stay in the hotel and head to the continental breakfast that is held in a little cafe room. Very cute! The location is just a short walk from seal beach and a short drive to hunington and long beach. Several places right around the hotel to have a nice dinner and nightlife is down on main stree just 2 miles away.
reviews.title: Definitely where you want to spend your time

reviews.text: There are certainly better hotels one could stay in. This is just a glorified motel. Kind of run down. Would not recommend it to a friend. It does have good (and free) WiFi, however. Some kind of a giant fan or compressor kicked on several times in the night outside of our room.
reviews.title: Not Worth The Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at Pacific Inn in the past and have enjoyed our experience. On this occasion however we checked in to find that major rennovations were in progress. No pool, jaccuzi, elevator, and workers using heavy machinery from 9-5pm with plastic walls not containing the dust or noise entering our room. We were stunned because we were not made aware of this at the time of our reservations. The managers did move us when I noticed a harsh paint odor in Room #1 but nothing could prevent the intrusiveness of this work in progress at Pacific Inn. The room itself was less than clean, bed skirt dirty, loose toilet seat, hair in shower. Then, noisy neighbors checked in next to us with adjoining door the persons might as well have been in our room. We couldn't wait to leave. Will never be back. Too bad; this place used to be one of our favorites.
reviews.title: Very disappointed!

reviews.text: The service for our 8 day stay was exceptionally outstanding thanks to the entire staff and manager, Mr. JP Ferguson. Unlike huge hotels, the Inn's 3 story size is perfect, no waiting for elevators, no lines to stand in, no hustle bustle, very relaxing and quaint. Everybody is super friendly, you feel like family. There were 3 females stayiing in the room, a senior, adult and 9 y/o child, we were all very comfortable.
reviews.title: An exceptionally QUAINT Inn for all ages, walk to the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free shuttle was so appreciated which takes you to many places of interest including Long Beach's Queen Mary. Superb location, walking distance to the beach, many restaurants, Main St.. For seniors thinking about retiring in Seal Beach, Leisure World is nearby, check it out.
reviews.title: Disappointed - Definitely a budget hotel

description: The Pacific Inn Hotel is located just a few blocks from the water in beautiful Seal Beach, California, one of Orange County’s best kept Secrets. The Pacific Inn offers many of the amenities you may expect at a larger hotel while maintaining the out-going service and attention of a wonderfully appointed boutique hotel. What separates The Pacific Inn from any other hotel is our superior location that makes us unique to any other property within a 20 mile radius. Our 71 newly renovated guest rooms are all non-smoking, featuring high speed wireless internet access, granite entryways and private balconies to enjoy the mild Southern California climate. We offer a complimentary shuttle service which travels anywhere within a 5 mile radius of the hotel. And a complimentary deluxe continental breakfast is served every morning in our breakfast café overlooking our open air atrium pool. Located in the heart of Seal Beach, a pleasant walk takes you to the Main Street shopping district, the Seal Beach Pier and over 30 local restaurants varying from casual to international cuisine. The Pacific Inn prides itself on going above and beyond for all Guests in an effort to exceed expectations.
